title: Countable & Uncountable Nouns
description: Слушайте и отличайте исчисляемые от неисчисляемых существительных.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at the supermarket. She checks her list. I need some milk.

options.text: She wants to buy milk.
She wants to buy eggs.
She wants to sell milk.
She already has milk.

tasks.explanation: 'Some milk' — milk is uncountable, used with 'some.' She needs to buy it. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A boy looks in the fridge. It is almost empty. There are only two eggs left.
tasks.transcript: There are only two eggs left.

options.text: There are many eggs in the fridge.
There are just two eggs in the fridge.
There is no food in the fridge.
There are two bottles of milk left.

tasks.explanation: 'Two eggs' — eggs are countable. 'Only two' means just two remain. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A man is at a cafe. He orders a drink. Can I have a cup of coffee, please?
tasks.transcript: Can I have a cup of coffee, please?

options.text: He orders a cup of tea.
He orders a cup of coffee.
He orders a glass of water.
He orders a piece of cake.

tasks.explanation: 'A cup of coffee' — coffee is uncountable, so we use 'a cup of.' Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A girl helps her mother in the kitchen. They are baking. We need a lot of sugar.
tasks.transcript: We need a lot of sugar.

options.text: They need a little sugar.
They need a lot of flour.
They need a lot of sugar.
They do not need sugar.

tasks.explanation: 'A lot of sugar' — sugar is uncountable. They need much sugar. Option 3 matches.

tasks.audioText: A teacher asks the students a question. They are in a science class. How much water is in the glass?
tasks.transcript: How much water is in the glass?

options.text: The teacher asks about the amount of water.
The teacher asks about the number of glasses.
The teacher asks about the color of water.
The teacher asks about the temperature of water.

tasks.explanation: 'How much water' uses 'much' because water is uncountable. It asks about quantity. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A man is at the bakery. He is hungry. Can I have a piece of bread, please?
tasks.transcript: Can I have a piece of bread, please?

options.text: He wants a whole loaf of bread.
He wants a piece of cake.
He wants a piece of bread.
He wants a bag of bread.

tasks.explanation: 'A piece of bread' — bread is uncountable, so we use 'a piece of.' Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman talks to a waiter at a restaurant. She is thirsty. I would like a glass of orange juice.
tasks.transcript: I would like a glass of orange juice.

options.text: She wants a glass of apple juice.
She wants a bottle of orange juice.
She wants a glass of orange juice.
She wants a glass of lemonade.

tasks.explanation: 'A glass of orange juice' — juice is uncountable. Option 3 matches exactly.

tasks.audioText: A boy is at the store with his mother. He looks at the fruit section. How many bananas do we need?
tasks.transcript: How many bananas do we need?

options.text: He asks how much the bananas cost.
He asks how many bananas to buy.
He asks if they like bananas.
He asks where the bananas are.

tasks.explanation: 'How many bananas' uses 'many' because bananas are countable. It asks about the number. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A father and daughter eat lunch together. The table has many dishes. There is some rice on the plate.
tasks.transcript: There is some rice on the plate.

options.text: There is rice on the plate.
There are noodles on the plate.
The plate is empty.
There is rice on the floor.

tasks.explanation: 'Some rice' — rice is uncountable, used with 'some.' Option 1 says the same thing.

tasks.audioText: A woman makes a shopping list. She writes carefully. I need an onion and some butter.
tasks.transcript: I need an onion and some butter.

options.text: She needs an onion and some cheese.
She needs some onions and an egg.
She needs an onion and some butter.
She needs some salt and some butter.

tasks.explanation: 'An onion' is countable (one), 'some butter' is uncountable. Option 3 matches both items.

tasks.audioText: A man goes to the office kitchen. He opens the cupboard. There is not much tea left.
tasks.transcript: There is not much tea left.

options.text: There is a lot of tea in the cupboard.
There is very little tea in the cupboard.
There is no coffee in the cupboard.
There are many cups in the cupboard.

tasks.explanation: 'Not much tea' means only a small amount remains. Tea is uncountable. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A girl is at a birthday party. She looks at the table. There are many cookies on the tray.
tasks.transcript: There are many cookies on the tray.

options.text: There are a few cookies on the tray.
There is one cookie on the tray.
There are a lot of cookies on the tray.
There are many cakes on the tray.

tasks.explanation: 'Many cookies' — cookies are countable. 'A lot of' means the same as 'many.' Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A cook prepares soup in the kitchen. She tastes it. The soup needs a little more salt.
tasks.transcript: The soup needs a little more salt.

options.text: The soup needs more pepper.
The soup needs a bit more salt.
The soup needs a lot more salt.
The soup is too salty.

tasks.explanation: 'A little more salt' — salt is uncountable. 'A bit more' means the same as 'a little more.' Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A man is at the airport. He checks his luggage. I have two suitcases and a bag.
tasks.transcript: I have two suitcases and a bag.

options.text: He has one suitcase and a bag.
He has two bags and a suitcase.
He has two suitcases and a bag.
He has three suitcases.

tasks.explanation: 'Two suitcases and a bag' — suitcases and bag are countable. Option 3 matches exactly.

tasks.audioText: A woman goes to the pharmacy. She feels sick. I need some medicine for my headache.
tasks.transcript: I need some medicine for my headache.

options.text: She needs medicine for a stomach ache.
She needs medicine for a headache.
She needs vitamins for energy.
She needs a bandage for her arm.

tasks.explanation: 'Some medicine for my headache' — medicine is uncountable. She has a headache. Option 2.

short_description: Тренируйте различение исчисляемых и неисчисляемых существительных на слух.
